greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: coefficients of polynomials p(x,n) defined by 1/(1-t-t^2)^x = Sum_{n=1..oo} p(x,n)*t^n/n!.
comment: A039692 is a similar triangle but without the leading column.
1/(1-t-t^2) is the g.f. for the Fibonacci numbers (A000045).
Also the Bell transform of n!*(F(n)+F(n+2)), F(n) the Fibonacci numbers. For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 21 2016
reference: Steve Roman, The Umbral Calculus, Dover Publications, New York (1984), pp. 149-150
maple: # The function BellMatrix is defined in A264428.
mathematica: p[t_] = 1/(1 - t - t^2)^x; Table[ ExpandAll[n!SeriesCoefficient[ Series[p[t], {t, 0, 30}], n]], {n, 0, 10}]; a = Table[n!* CoefficientList[SeriesCoefficient[ Series[p[t], {t, 0, 30}], n], x], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[a]
BellMatrix[f_, len_] := With[{t = Array[f, len, 0]}, Table[BellY[n, k, t], {n, 0, len - 1}, {k, 0, len - 1}]];
Table[B[[n, k]], {n, 1, rows}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 28 2018, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Apr 17 2008
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 28 2011
